story.text: (Updates with reaction to ADP report and Home Depot news)NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks looked set to start the year higher on Wednesday, with shares of Home Depot Inc. (HD.N) jumping after the resignation of its chairman and chief executive. A drop in oil prices also boosted futures. S&P futures briefly pared gains after the ADP National Employment report showed a surprise decline in private sector jobs in December. Home Depot shares rose before the opening bell after the home-improvement chain said Chief Executive and Chairman Robert Nardelli will leave the company. [ID:nWEN1685] Home Depot shares rose 6.2 percent to $42.66 in electronic composite trading. S&P 500 futures SPc1 were up 7.6 points, above fair value, a mathematical formula that evaluates pricing by taking into account interest rates, dividends and time to expiration on the contract. Dow Jones industrial average futures DJc1 rose 76 points, and Nasdaq 100 NDc1 futures gained 16.25 points.
story.title: us stocks - futures point up on home depot , oil
